title: language_test_4_2
prompt:
What is the best way to complete blank 2?

The chemical reactions in the battery ![dropdown:Drop_Down_710_89] electrons to build up at the anode, or negative terminal.
feedback: The correct answer is "cause." The sentence should read: “The chemical reactions in the battery cause electrons to build up at the anode, or negative terminal.” The subject of this sentence is the plural word “reactions.” It needs a plural verb: “cause.”  Because there is a phrase ending in a singular word (“in the battery”) between the subject and verb, it might be difficult to tell which verb is correct. If you remove the phrase, it’s easier to tell which answer is correct. “The chemical reactions cause electrons to build up” sounds correct. “The chemical reactions causes electrons to build up” sounds wrong.
